Description: Pottery oil-lamp: small, round oil-lamp of light brown clay with protruding nozzle; reserved save black nozzle; plain base, slightly concave; shallow interior with large central hole; no handle.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Unprovenanced parallel from Egypt, dated from the 6th to 5th century BC or 'considerably later' (Bailey 1975, British Museum Lamps I, Q514, see also 6th century import Q374). Copy or variant of Greek type found at Athens (Howland 1958, Type 16). Howland, R.H. 1958. The Athenian Agora, IV, Greek lamps and their survivals, Princeton.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KC.17) (Phase 3)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5898 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
